verses.verse: Then Bildad <S%H1085><s%> the Shuhite <S%H7747><s%> responded, <S%H6030><s%> <S%H559><s%>
"How <S%H575><s%> long <S%H5704><s%> will you hunt <S%H7760><s%> <S%H7078><s%> for words <S%H4405><s%>? Show <S%H995><s%> understanding <S%H995><s%> and then <S%H310><s%> we can talk. <S%H1696><s%>
"Why <S%H4069><s%> are we regarded <S%H2803><s%> as beasts, <S%H929><s%> As stupid <S%H2933><s%> in your eyes <S%H5869><s%>?

"O you who tear <S%H2963><s%> yourself <S%H5315><s%> in your anger <S%H639><s%> â€“ For your sake <S%H4616><s%> is the earth <S%H776><s%> to be abandoned, <S%H5800><s%> Or the rock <S%H6697><s%> to be moved <S%H6275><s%> from its place <S%H4725><s%>?

"Indeed, <S%H1571><s%> the light <S%H216><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> goes <S%H1846><s%> out, And the flame <S%H7632><s%> of his fire <S%H784><s%> gives <S%H5050><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> light. <S%H5050><s%>
"The light <S%H216><s%> in his tent <S%H168><s%> is darkened, <S%H2821><s%> And his lamp <S%H5216><s%> goes <S%H1846><s%> out above <S%H5921><s%> him.
"His vigorous <S%H202><s%> stride <S%H6806><s%> is shortened, <S%H9503><s%> And his own scheme <S%H6098><s%> brings <S%H7993><s%> him down. <S%H7993><s%>
"For he is thrown <S%H7971><s%> into the net <S%H7568><s%> by his own feet, <S%H7272><s%> And he steps <S%H1980><s%> on the webbing. <S%H7639><s%>
"A snare <S%H6341><s%> seizes <S%H270><s%> [him] by the heel, <S%H6119><s%> [And] a trap <S%H6782><s%> snaps <S%H2388><s%> shut <S%H2388><s%> on him.
"A noose <S%H9112><s%> for him is hidden <S%H2934><s%> in the ground, <S%H776><s%> And a trap <S%H4434><s%> for him on the path. <S%H5410><s%>
"All <S%H5439><s%> around <S%H5439><s%> terrors <S%H1091><s%> frighten <S%H1204><s%> him, And harry <S%H6327><s%> him at every step. <S%H7272><s%>
"His strength <S%H202><s%> is famished, <S%H7457><s%> And calamity <S%H343><s%> is ready <S%H3559><s%> at his side. <S%H6763><s%>
"His skin <S%H5785><s%> is devoured <S%H398><s%> by disease, <S%H905><s%> The first-born of death <S%H4194><s%> devours <S%H398><s%> his limbs. <S%H905><s%>
"He is torn <S%H5423><s%> from the security <S%H4009><s%> of his tent, <S%H168><s%> And they march <S%H6805><s%> him before the king <S%H4428><s%> of terrors. <S%H1091><s%>
"There dwells <S%H7931><s%> in his tent <S%H168><s%> nothing <S%H1097><s%> of his; Brimstone <S%H1614><s%> is scattered <S%H2219><s%> on his habitation. <S%H5116><s%>
"His roots <S%H8328><s%> are dried <S%H3001><s%> below, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H8478><s%> And his branch <S%H9524><s%> is cut <S%H9268><s%> off <S%H9268><s%> above. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H4605><s%>
"Memory <S%H2143><s%> of him perishes from the earth, <S%H6><s%> And he has no <S%H776><s%> name <S%H3808><s%> abroad. <S%H8034><s%> <S%H6440><s%>
"He is driven <S%H1920><s%> from light <S%H216><s%> into darkness, <S%H2822><s%> And chased <S%H5074><s%> from the inhabited <S%H8398><s%> world. <S%H8398><s%>
"He has no <S%H3808><s%> offspring <S%H5209><s%> or posterity <S%H5220><s%> among his people, <S%H5971><s%> Nor <S%H369><s%> any survivor <S%H8300><s%> where <S%H4033><s%> he sojourned. <S%H4033><s%>
"Those in the west <S%H314><s%> are appalled <S%H8074><s%> at his fate, <S%H3117><s%> And those in the east <S%H6931><s%> are seized <S%H270><s%> with horror. <S%H9623><s%>

"Surely <S%H389><s%> such <S%H428><s%> are the dwellings <S%H4908><s%> of the wicked, <S%H5767><s%> And this <S%H2088><s%> is the place <S%H4725><s%> of him who does not know <S%H3045><s%> God. <S%H410><s%>"
